runs.comm: down the leg side and flicked to fine leg with a cheery roar from the crowd
wide of the off stump and ignored
Bopara takes a step outside leg to try and unsettle Steyn, and it's a leg-side delivery which is worked off the pads for a crowd-pleasing single
fast, spicy delivery but well played by Wright, dropping it down past gully and they run a sharp and well-judged single
outside off - no swing really from Steyn, and Bopara leaves alone
bowled him! A much slower delivery, an off-cutter, wide of the off stump at which Bopara threw his hands, and the inside edge knocked over his off peg. Gone!
crashed out to the off side. Good timing, poor placement
a huge, massive appeal for a catch behind. Wright flayed his hands at it, missing, and in fairness Boucher never really went up. Nowhere near it
fuller and again Wright attempts a thudding slap through cover but misses
excellent delivery cutting back on Wright
gone this time! Wright's walking! Another swing-and-a-miss from Wright, and this time he does edge it behind
Parnell's first poor delivery, down the leg side and flipped for a single
angled down to third man - wideish ball
four! And what a noise from the crowd - a huge roar as Pietersen flicks it powerfully through midwicket
excellent ball just outside off but that's a textbook straight drive from Pietersen and the crowd let him know it! A tremendous roar once more to a beautiful off-drive
a huge shout from Steyn - that's out! Is it? No! Perhaps a bit high? Good grief that's seriously tight! The replays suggest it was just sneaking over...
extravagantly left alone outside off. Pietersen looks to Tony Hill with a big smile on his face, expecting him to call it a wide. Hill smiles back, his hands remaining steadfast by his side
defended out to the off side
Pietersen ignores it outside off, watches it sail by. Good carry through to Boucher
crashed to cover! Straight to cover, though
very good, straight delivery banged back to the bowler who threatens to wang into Pietersen's skull. He keeps hold of it instead
Pietersen rocks forward, then rocks back into a punchy defence. Doubtless wary of who is the non-striker, he roars no louder than he might otherwise
driven to mid-on and he sets off. Shah's a little slow out of the blocks - natch - but they're home
quality over. Pushed out to cover - really, really tight bowling this
straight and nudged to leg
too straight and worked off his pads with a charge down the wicket by Pietersen - Botha makes a hash of it at fine-leg, much to the crowd's delight. Great, triumphant noise
down the pitch and pulls it just wide of the keeper - four more!
a massive swing and a miss! Careless shot really
flicked to leg - and they take the single
that's a good, tight line with which to end the over, cutting back into Shah who defends and screams a squeeky, desperate "no"
good line, cutting back into the right hander

what a catch, what a stunner from van der Merwe! A full toss, Pietersen tried to smash it over mid-on but couldn't loft it and van der Merwe dived to his left to take it aerially, almost behind him, with two hands. Fantastic snaffle!
defended on the front foot
wide of the off stump and left alone
such a Collingwood shot. A dinky, mistimed, plywood-sounding donk out to cover
that's better, more power in the stroke but it's straight to cover

dabbed out to extra cover - but who's the fielder? Gibbs! In comes the throw and it's a direct hit! Replays are horribly inconclusive - it's impossible to give him out on that evidence but it's yet further proof just how fired-up South Africa are. They're in screaming form tonight
dabbed off the back foot straight back to the bowler
cracked square of the wicket
defended on the back foot
gives himself room to the leg side, defending out to cover
very full, Collingwood cracks it back to the bowler
defended back to the bowler
well bowled, much quicker and fired into his pads
tries to sweep...but it's a wide
flicked to leg for a single - ironic, and slightly ridiculous, cheers that England have found a run
on his legs and chipped just wide - only just! - of midwicket, but South Africa's outfielding on the boundary is slick and alert, saving four without so much as breaking sweat
squared up and they steal two more. But Shah is seriously slow out of the blocks and has to dive in - he looks like he's running on sand
faster and speared into his pads, pushed out to the off side
defended on the off stump
swept to short fine leg
down the leg side and again he tries to sweep, but it's a wide
full toss and four! Bunted through cover. A rare loose delivery from a South African and that's England's first boundary in four overs
steps to leg, guiding it out off the back foot
very fast and straight in at the stumps! A yorker. So hard to dig that out
a beamer pulled to deep square leg, but not given as no-ball. Erm - that was neck-high, or certainly above shoulder. Odd decision
Shah steps outside leg; van der Merwe fires it into the leg side
goes leg-side with a sweep but only for a single
a leading edge out to deep extra cover
driven hard out to long-off
ooh, fine yorker! Can't do anything with that. Shah was going to sweep, then realised it was heading towards his off stump at a rate of knots, so he adjusted to dab it defensively
chipped uppishly, but short of mid-off! This is outstanding bowling, it really is
a swept single off the pads
reverse sweep out to deep point...or deep square leg, depending on your view
another yorker defended
full toss banged for six! That's woken up the crowd. They're here for sixes, not dots...
defended on the front foot
tickled to leg
Shah's got hold of this. A skip down the pitch and he lofts him high and handsome over long-off for six
savage! A ferociously slapped four through extra cover
more. More! Down the leg side and flogged over midwicket, flat, and very nearly for six
tickled to leg
Colly nurdles this to long-on. Top nurdling
a phantom step outside leg, before nudging a single to short midwicket
lovely crunchy shot and he's timed the pants off it, pulling through midwicket but straight to the fielder
ooh a paddle down the leg side! Boucher gloved it - that's cheeky from Collingwood
bowled him! Stumps shattered as Collingwood steps to leg and is castled by an 86mph middle-stump yorker
oh what a ball! A bouncer which nearly decapitates Foster, snapping his head out of the way. 90mph from Kallis...
swing and a miss outside off
tries to pull this fast, aggressive bouncer and flings it to leg
gone! Reverse swept but mistimed and short third man makes a leap high to his right, a fine catch
flicked to leg
down the leg side, Mascarenhas works it to square leg
a wide down the leg side
down the leg side
oh that's awful. Far too close to be cutting, and it's a little quicker than he expected. The off stump is ruined, as are England
flicked to the leg side
steps to leg and guides to third man
four down the leg side, clipping it nicely
odd shot - caught in two minds whether to drive or defend or leave. So, that's three minds he was caught in
terrific ball on the off stump at 88mph. They just haven't given England a sniff
beautiful - brilliant from Kallis. That is a stunning leg-cutter! Shah nibbled and Boucher did the rest. This is some display from South Africa
horrid shot, a loose flap outside off
flicked to leg
where's this gone? (Why am I asking you?) It's swept just short of deep square leg
flicked to leg
quicker - much quicker and he beats the attempted cut
er, gone, I think. Tried to smite him over midwicket and got a leading edge to short third man. Barely a celebration; it's all too facile for South Africa
neatly turned to leg
fast and straight, driven neatly but - wow - de Villiers dives brilliantly at short third man to save four. Stunning
a bouncer, wide of the off stump, cut down to third man
he follows this outswinger, trying to cover-drive it but missing
a swing and a miss outside off
oops! Well wide of the off stump
Rashid steps to leg and whacks it back to the bowler...no power in the stroke
wide of the off stump
Broad stands tall, slaps, misses
worked out to the off side. Gibbs again hits the stumps - 2 out of 2 tonight for him - though there was no chance of a run-out
wide down the leg side
nicely timed but who's there at point? de Villiers. No chance of a run
good yorker but Rashid dabs it to leg
down the leg side and worked to third man
a thumping slog but Rashid has yet to time the ball since he came in
hammered to mid-on
wide of the off stump. But not a wide! Well, that's a little unfair to be honest. The ball was only just inside the white line
another short ball, Rashid tries to whack it through midwicket
and again he plays and misses. Rashid swings and misses over midwicket. Poor Rashid, he's just completely inexperienced. Nothing he can do
a touch fuller and he's got contact down to long-off
slower ball, wellied to mid-on
pulled over midwicket
full and straight, bashed to long-on
Broad heaves this high, but how long? Smith's dropped it on the boundary - he leapt high, clasped it, but fell over and parried it for four
bowled. 87mph yorker rips out the off stump - a superb delivery.  Parnell is a serious prospect.
gives himself room and he too is bowled - another middle-stump yorker. Parnell wraps things up in stunning style
